Bailey has a masters of theology from Southern Methodist University and a Ph.D. in family economics from Texas Tech University. Dr. Bailey is associate professor in the School of Human Environmental Sciences at the University of Arkansas, where he teaches personal finance and family science. He is also past national program leader for family economics for the Cooperative States Research, Education, and Economics Service in USDA and continues to conduct research on attitudes about money and marriage
